usefulItems: bowl, paper towels, pastry brush, casserole dish (9 in. x 13 in.), baking sheets, oven
title: Moussaka

ingredients.content: 48 oz eggplant, cut into ¼ in. slices (approx. 3 large eggplants)
3 tsp fine sea salt, divided, to taste
4 oz Parmigiano Reggiano, cut into pieces
½ oz fresh parsley, leaves and tender stems (approx. ½ bunch)
9 oz yellow onions, halved (approx. 2 medium onions)
¼ tsp ground nutmeg, divided, to taste
½ tsp ground black pepper, divided, to taste
4 oz salted butter, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Place Varoma into position and weigh in eggplant slices. Place slices around sides of Varoma dish, sprinkle with 1 tsp salt and continue salting each layer until all eggplant is used. Set aside for 30 minutes. Grease a casserole dish (9 in. x 13 in.) and 2 baking sheets and set aside.
Place cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place garlic, parsley and peppercorns into mixing bowl and grate <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil and beef, break into pieces with spatula and sauté <b>3 min/212°F//speed <b>.

Add tomatoes, wine, oregano, cinnamon, 1 tsp salt, cayenne and ⅛  tsp nutmeg and cook <b>20 min/212°F//speed <b>. Meanwhile, rinse eggplant in cold water to remove excess salt. Gently pat dry with paper towels. Place eggplant slices onto baking sheets and lightly brush with oil, season with 1 tsp salt and ¼ tsp ground pepper. Broil in oven 2 minutes each side flipping so both sides are tender and golden brown.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange eggplant slices in casserole dish. Cover eggplant with meat sauce. No need to clean mixing bowl.
Place butter, milk, flour, eggs and ¼ tsp ground pepper into mixing bowl and cook <b>8 min/195°F/speed 4<b>. Adjust seasoning to taste.

Add 2 oz reserved grated cheese and mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>. Cover meat layer with white sauce, top with remaining grated cheese and lightly sprinkle with ⅛ tsp nutmeg. Bake 30 minutes (400°F). Allow Moussaka to rest for 10 minutes to firm then cut into squares and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Nutmeg has a delicate, spicy flavor that starts to dissipate shortly after being ground. Grinding your own results in more flavor from a smaller amount. You can freshly grind a whole nutmeg for this recipe. Prior to grinding the cheese, place nutmeg into mixing bowl and grind <b>1 min/speed 9<b>. Transfer to bowl and set aside or store in an airtight container.
